terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Wisconsin northwoods. Moderate elevation with forest scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Wisconsin event. Northwoods terrain with moderate access, low costs, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: BURGR 95 is a local event in Wisconsin—northwoods terrain with moderate elevation. The Wisconsin northwoods are scenic and it's good value, but the small local field and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Wisconsin northwoods gravel race. Worth it for Wisconsin/Midwest riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Wisconsin—yes, it's good value. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Wisconsin races: Chequamegon, Bear 100.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Gleason has limited lodging options. Book ahead.
logistics.food: Gleason has limited dining options. Stock nutrition.

logistics.explanation: Meeting at Z's Fork Horners on Highway X requires navigation to rural Wisconsin with registration by blog comment. Organizers specify "You will need a way to hold your cue sheet whether a stem bag with a window, clip board, binder clips, or the cuff of your shorts."

length.explanation: Finish times show the distance delivers: Joel Hynes finished in 6:09, with most riders between 6-7 hours. Fat bikers Tim Jennings and Joe Kraznarich needed 7:26, while Jason Dostal took 7:50. The organizer warns "You will be on the road for 5 to 7 hours." Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: Course includes "rocky fire roads" alongside fast gravel, with the organizer noting "Road bikes will not survive some fire road segments." Later editions added "Machine-Built Singletrack" and "That part at mile 70 that will Really Test You." Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: The BURGR99 evolution features "Two Mile-long Descents" through Wisconsin's rolling terrain. Lookout Mountain provides the main climbing challenge, but this remains Wisconsin gravel rather than mountainous suffering. Less climbing than The Mid South.

altitude.explanation: Starting near Gleason around 1600 feet with Lookout Mountain as the high point means sea level cycling conditions. Zero altitude considerations for this Wisconsin countryside ride. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The organizer warns "You will be in bear and wolf territory most of the time" and "will not pass through any town ever." Self-navigation through remote wilderness adds uncertainty, though phone coverage works "most of the time."

prestige.explanation: Registration requires only a blog comment: "For all legal purposes this is just a friendly group ride through the woods where you are, of course, responsible for you." Chris Schotz appears in multiple years' results, suggesting local regular participation.

race_quality.explanation: Self-supported with paper cue sheets and no course marking. The organizer states "Like with any other training ride, you will be responsible for yourself and should not count on rescue from anyone."

experience.explanation: The route travels through Lincoln, Langlade, and Oneida Counties with highlights including Jack Lake water stop and Summit Lake BP station with ice cream. Post-ride gatherings happen at Z's Fork Horners with "great burgers and pizza."

community.explanation: Part of Ironbear 1000 mile challenge with consistent riders like Chris Schotz returning across years. The organizer notes "Usually folks hang out following the event at the Z's Fork Horners afterwards" for post-ride community time.

field_depth.explanation: Results show small fields with Joel Hynes, Russel Bernard, and Randy Wegener finishing within four minutes in 2016. Seven finishers listed for the 2018 BURGR99, indicating limited competitive depth for this free group ride. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder.

value.explanation: Completely free entry with registration by blog comment only. The organizer evolved from 32c to 40c tires, noting "They will get the job done. I switched to 40c tires this year and I'm not going back."

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $75-100. Free entry with camping available at the Underdown for those wanting cheap lodging "7.5 miles from the Lighthouse." The organizer recommends Bambino's downtown "for beer, pizza, and more ice cream afterwards." Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
